Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: Genomic Sequencing of Pediatric Rhaboid Cancers
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: Genomic Sequencing of Pediatric Rhaboid Cancers
Configuration.Description: In this study, we sequenced the exomes of 35 rhabdoid tumors, highly aggressive cancers of early childhood. This study is part of a larger effort to characterize pediatric cancers as part of the Slim Initiative for Genomic Medicine (SIGMA) project.

Header.title: Principal Investigator
Header.Institution: Dana Farber Cancer Institute, Boston MA, USA

Header.title: Funding Source
Header.Institution: Carlos Slim Health Institute, Mexico City, Mexico

ParticipantSet.UseLimitation: These data may be used for biomedical research by qualified investigators that are performing research that can only be conducted by using pediatric data (i.e., the research objectives cannot be accomplished using data from adults) and that have likely relevance to developing more effective treatments, diagnostic tests, or prognostic markers for childhood cancers.

Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
